✨ AI内容分析
• 增长陷阱: 2个注册/$0收入反映PMF缺失 • 技术债危机: $1500 Cursor账单暴露架构缺陷
🏷️ SaaS创业 · 产品增长 · 技术债务
ILIAS ISM
@illyism
i dont think you understand

you catch 3am dopamine and vibe code a saas

you drop $49 on a .ai domain

you launch on producthunt, tweet it, it gets 7 likes

you get 2 signups, $0 MRR, gmail accounts, one asks if it’s free

your net margins are -200% from vercel and clerk auth

Cursor bill is $1,500 so you sell your car

your girlfriend asks why you’re building "an app no one uses"

your parents send you job listings “just in case”

a German guy demands a VAT invoice and threatens to report you

you google “what is VAT” at 4am, sweating

someone else ships your idea and it goes viral

supabase email that it's going to pause your project

you panic-buy 3 more domains because "next time will work", .com this time

you vibe code another saas, forget the first one exists, Claude Code this time

you own 12 domains, 2 half-finished apps, and declining sanity

your only user is you, refreshing your own landing page

you spend 8 hours tweaking blog dark mode instead of marketing

you flip one domain for $50 and feel like Jeff Bezos

why are you shipping another side project again?

i dont think you understand
❤️ 1,222
🔄 71
💬 174
👁️ 75,885
查看原推文 2025/6/30 23:51:22
item.author: illyism@twitter.com (ILIAS ISM)

item.title: ⭐8分 #SaaS #创业经验 SaaS创业真相：从幻想到现实的必经之路
item.description: #SaaS #创业经验 推文揭露了SaaS创业的残酷现实，指出平均需要2-3年达到1万美元月收入，大多数创始人会经历3-4次失败。批判了过度简化创业过程的误导性内容，强调成功需要直面困难而非逃避现实。
item.content:encoded:
🤖 AI评分 (⭐8/10分)
推文揭示了SaaS创业的真实挑战和常见误区，对独立开发者有警示和启发作用，但缺乏具体操作建议。
📊 维度评分: 独立开发相关性9/10 · 实用性8/10 · 可操作性6/10
🏷️ SaaS · 创业经验 · 失败教训
✨ AI内容分析
• 创业周期长: 平均2 • 失败是常态: 多数人经历3
🏷️ SaaS创业 · 增长黑客 · 产品验证
Shayan
@ImSh4yy
Can you build a profitable SaaS? Absolutely. Is it as simple as Greg makes it sound? Come on, that's LinkedIn success porn. lmfao.

The average SaaS takes 2-3 years to hit $10k MRR. Most founders burn through 3-4 failed ideas before one clicks.

This is a naive oversimplification of the process and is misleading and potentially damaging for people who are just starting out.

It sets people up to feel like failures when they hit completely normal obstacles, like spending 6 months on a product nobody wants.

It's not a mental blocker, it's just what happens, and it hurts like a bitch.

Pretending the hard parts don't exist isn't abundance mindset, it's lying to yourself. Real abundance is knowing the game is hard and knowing there are still tons of ways to win.
❤️ 564
🔄 13
💬 13
👁️ 22,730
查看原推文 2025/6/30 10:11:48
item.author: ImSh4yy@twitter.com (Shayan)

item.title: ⭐9分 #收入分享 #增长策略 单人创作者业务月入3.8万美元的深度解析
item.description: #收入分享 #增长策略 分析AlexFinnX单人创作者业务5月收入3.8万美元案例，揭示SaaS产品、多平台变现与AI赋能的成功路径，提供可复制的增长策略。
item.content:encoded:
🤖 AI评分 (⭐9/10分)
推文详细分享了独立开发者的收入来源、增长策略和未来计划，具有高度实用性和可操作性。
📊 维度评分: 独立开发相关性10/10 · 实用性9/10 · 可操作性9/10
🏷️ 收入分享 · 增长策略 · 独立开发
✨ AI内容分析
• SaaS爆发增长: `Creator Buddy`贡献79%收入，利润率90% • 平台矩阵效应: `X/YT/Newsletter`形成3大辅助收入支柱
🏷️ 创作者经济 · SaaS增长 · AI变现
Alex Finn
@AlexFinnX
How much money my 1 person creator business made in May:

🎨Creator Buddy (SaaS): $30,777
📅X subscriptions: $2,062
💬X ad revenue: $1,918.60
📹YT ad revenue: $1,138.90
🗣️X Spaces sponsorships $1,500
✏️ Newsletter sponsorships: $1,500

Total earned: $38,896.50 (90% margins)

Revenue streams I cut out:
📝Consulting (saves me 4 hours a week)

On pace for $466,000 this year. Would love to break $500,000 for the first time ever.

Have some plans to hit that goal including a new enterprise tier of Creator Buddy as well as a new general AI agent I'm working on.

YT revenue should only be going up aggressively, my growth has exploded there the last month (5k new subs)

Continuing to cut out activities like consulting that took up time and were low leverage. Losing revenue there but it's an investment in the future

You 100% can build successful 1 person creator businesses in 2025.

Cut out the bad habits. Use AI to it's max. Share value in your content.

Everything else will fall into place

Conrad Bastable
@ConradBastable
If you work in tech, go to your nearest Best Buy (google it, it’s a store for normal people) and buy a $500 windows laptop made by a legacy vendor. Not a Chromebook.

Go through the 60m setup flow full of SaaS ads. Feel it lag when you press Start. Experience notification hell.
